The length of the 285 ACE2 protein sequences ranged from 431 to 872 amino acids ( Supplementary Table S3), where most ACE2 sequences were composed of about 800 amino acids ( Supplementary Figure S1a). Five ACE2 sequences were partial ( Bison bison bison, Thamnophis sirtalis, Haliaeetus albicilla, Fulmarus glacialis, and Panthera tigris altaica), but there were no missing interface residues according to sequence analysis. The ACE2 orthologs shared a sequence identity of ≥55% with hACE2 ( Supplementary Figure S1b), indicating that the ACE2 proteins were conserved. Therefore, reliable structure models could be built by homology modeling. On the basis of the experimental structure of the hACE2/S-RBD complex, 20 residues (Q24, T27, F28, D30, K31, H34, E35, E37, D38, Y41, Q42, L79, M82, Y83, N330, K353, G354, D355, R357, and R393) were present at the interface of hACE2 within 4 Å of S-RBD.
30 Among the ACE2 orthologs, the sequence identities of the 20 interface residues to hACE2 ranged from 30% to 100% ( Supplementary Figure S1c), while the sequence identities for the five key interface residues (K31, E35, D38, M82, and K353), which were regarded as important elements to determine host range,
31 varied from 0 to 100% ( Supplementary Figure S1d).
